edu.umd.cs.dmonner.tweater
Class Querier

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      edu.umd.cs.dmonner.tweater.Querier
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Querier
extends java.lang.Thread

The main point of contact with the Twitter Streaming API. It handles connecting to the API, and then sends all pertinent info to every StatusQueue that was registered via the addServer method. This class periodically asks the supplied QueryBuilder for the current query, and handles re-connecting to the Twitter Streaming API if the query is out of date.

Author:
dmonner

public void addQueue(StatusQueue queue)
Adds a new queue which will receive all statuses that this querier receives.

Parameters:

connect

public void connect()
Connects to the Twitter Streaming API with the current query. If this querier has been marked as shut down, this method does nothing.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Disconnects from the Twitter Streaming API.

setQuery

public void setQuery(java.util.Collection<QueryItem> items)
Replaces the current query with one defined by the given collection. Disconnects from Twitter if necessary and immediately reconnects with the new query.

Parameters:
items -

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shuts down this querier, disconnecting it permanently from Twitter.
